channel.title: Help with this?
channel.description: Alright I want to order my friends: [code=php]$query = mysql_query("SELECT u.* FROM friends uf inner join users u on uf.friend = u.username WHERE uf.user = '$user'") or die(mysql_error());[/code] Like this: [code=php] $xptype = findType($table)."xp"; $sql = mysql_query("SELECT * FROM skills ORDER BY $xptype DESC") or die(mysql_error());[/code] How would I do it? EDIT: [code=php] $friends = $row['username']; $sql = mysql_query("SELECT * FROM skills ORDER BY $xptype DESC WHERE playerName LIKE '$friends'") or die(mysql_error()); [/code] I keep getting this error: You have an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that corresponds to your MySQL server version for the right syntax to use near 'WHERE playerName LIKE 'Kingz Klutch'' at line 1

item.title: Help with this?
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

[quote=“Ecko, post:9, topic:451918”]Move the $rank line before the query
Change the ORDER BY ‘$xptype’ to ORDER BY ‘$rank’[/quote]
It still didn’t sort like it would with regular hiscores. It is still not ordering by the rank.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with this?
item.dc:creator: @Ecko Ecko
item.description:
@Ecko wrote:

Move the $rank line before the query
Change the ORDER BY ‘$xptype’ to ORDER BY ‘$rank’

Read full topic

item.title: Help with this?
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

Ecko:

Well I don’t really know what your findType() function does. A little clarification will help.

]function findType($table) { if($table == "" || $table == 0) { return "Overall"; } else if($table == "1") { return "Attack"; } else if($table == "2") { return "Defence"; } else if($table == "3") { return "Strength"; } else if($table == "4") { return "Constitution"; } else if($table == "5") { return "Range"; } else if($table == "6") { return "Prayer"; } else if($table == "7") { return "Magic"; } else if($table == "8") { return "Cooking"; } else if($table == "9") { return "Woodcutting"; } else if($table == "10") { return "Fletching"; } else if($table == "11") { return "Fishing"; } else if($table == "12") { return "Firemaking"; } else if($table == "13") { return "Crafting"; } else if($table == "14") { return "Smithing"; } else if($table == "15") { return "Mining"; } else if($table == "16") { return "Herblore"; } else if($table == "17") { return "Agility"; } else if($table == "18") { return "Thieving"; } else if($table == "19") { return "Slayer"; } else if($table == "20") { return "Farming"; } else if($table == "21") { return "Runecraft"; } else if($table == "22") { return "Hunter"; } else if($table == "23") { return "Construction"; } else if($table == "24") { return "Summoning"; } else if($table == "25") { return "Dungeoneering"; } }

Read full topic

item.title: Help with this?
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

It still doesn’t sort them by the xp type.

2d7vdcp.png839×738

function findFriends($table){ include "mysql.php"; $user = $_SESSION['username']; $query = mysql_query("SELECT u.* FROM friends uf inner join users u on uf.friend = u.username WHERE uf.user = '$user'") or die(mysql_error()); echo ' <div class="tableContainer cssTableSmall"> <div class="hiscoresBoxTopLeft"></div> <div class="hiscoresBoxTopRight"></div> <div class="tableInnerContainer"> <div class="header"> <span class="columnRank">Rank</span> <span class="columnName"> <span>Name</span> </span> <span class="columnLevel"> <span>Level</span> </span> <span class="columnXp"> <span>XP</span> </span> </div>'; WHILE($row = mysql_fetch_array($query)){ $friends = $row['username']; $xptype = findType($table)."xp"; $sql = mysql_query("SELECT * FROM skills WHERE playerName LIKE '$friends' ORDER BY '$xptype' DESC") or die(mysql_error()); while($rows = mysql_fetch_array($sql)){ $rank = findRank($friends, "$table"); $count = count($friends); if(dots($rows[$xptype]) !=0){ for($i=0;$i<$count;$i++){ if($i == $count){ echo ' <a name="'.$rank.'"></a> <a href="compare.php?user1='.$friends.'" target="_self" class="row last-row">'; }else{ echo ' <a name="'.$count.'"></a> <a href="compare.php?user1='.$friends.'" target="_self" class="row ">'; } echo' <span class="columnRank"> <span>'.$rank.'</span> </span> <span class="columnName"> <span>'.BBCode($friends).'</span> </span> <span class="columnLevel"> <span>'.getLevelForXP($rows[$xptype]).'</span> </span> <span class="columnXp"> <span>'.dots($rows[$xptype]).'</span> </span> </a> '; } } } } }

Read full topic

item.title: Help with this?
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

Alright I want to order my friends: $query = mysql_query("SELECT u.* FROM friends uf inner join users u on uf.friend = u.username WHERE uf.user = '$user'") or die(mysql_error());
Like this:

$xptype = findType($table)."xp"; $sql = mysql_query("SELECT * FROM skills ORDER BY $xptype DESC") or die(mysql_error());
How would I do it?
EDIT:

$friends = $row['username'];
$sql = mysql_query("SELECT * FROM skills ORDER BY $xptype DESC WHERE playerName LIKE '$friends'") or die(mysql_error());

I keep getting this error:
You have an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that corresponds to your MySQL server version for the right syntax to use near ‘WHERE playerName LIKE ‘Kingz Klutch’’ at line 1

Read full topic
